string-array.name: goodFriday
string-array.item: Good Friday
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday
Good Friday is a religious holiday, observed primarily by Christians, commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary.

string-array.name: easterMondayCanada
string-array.item: Easter Monday
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday
Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and is celebrated as a holiday in some largely Christian cultures, especially Catholic and Eastern Christian cultures. Observed in Quebec.

string-array.name: nlwData
string-array.item: 150209~Canada~Family Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_Day_(Canada)~A statutory holiday occurring on a Monday in February. Observed in Alberta, Ontario, PEI and Saskatchewan.

150403~Canada~Good Friday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday~Good Friday is a religious holiday, observed primarily by Christians, commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary.

150406~Canada~Easter Monday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday~Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and is celebrated as a holiday in some largely Christian cultures, especially Catholic and Eastern Christian cultures. Observed in Quebec.
150518~Canada~Victoria Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_Day~A federal Canadian public holiday celebrated on the last Monday before May 25, in honour of Queen Victoria\'s birthday.
150701~Canada~Canada Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada_Day~National day of Canada, celebrating the anniversary of the July 1, 1867, enactment of the British North America Act, 1867
150803~Canada~Civic Holiday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civic_Holiday~A public holiday celebrated in most of Canada on the first Monday in August
150907~Canada~Labour Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Day~Annual holiday to celebrate the achievements of workers

151012~Canada~Thanksgiving~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanksgiving_(Canada)~Occurring on the second Monday in October, is an annual Canadian holiday which celebrates the harvest and other blessings of the past year.

151111~Canada~Remembrance Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remembrance_Day~A memorial day observed in Commonwealth countries since the end of World War I to remember the members of their armed forces who have died in the line of duty
151225~Canada~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
151226~Canada~Boxing Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Day~The first or second weekday after Christmas Day.Observed in Ontario

160101~Canada~New Year\’s Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar as well as the Julian calendar used in the Roman Empire since 45 BC.

150216~USA~Washington\'s Birthday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington\'s_Birthday~A United States federal holiday celebrated on the third Monday of February in honor of George Washington, the first President of the United States.
150525~USA~Memorial Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memorial_Day~A day of remembering the men and women who died while serving in the United States Armed Forces

150703~USA~Independence Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(United_States)~Commemorating the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776, declaring independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain. July 4 being Saturday, holiday will be on July 3.
150907~USA~Labor Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labor_Day~A celebration of the American labor movement and is dedicated to the social and economic achievements of workers
151012~USA~Columbus Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbus_Day~The anniversary of Christopher Columbus\' arrival in the Americas, which happened on October 12, 1492
151111~USA~Veterans Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veterans_Day~Honors people who have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, also known as veterans
151126~USA~Thanksgiving Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanksgiving~A day of giving thanks for the blessing of the harvest and of the preceding year
151225~USA~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
160101~USA~New Year\’s Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar as well as the Julian calendar used in the Roman Empire since 45 BC.

160118~USA~Martin Luther King, Jr. Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Luther_King,_Jr._Day~An American federal holiday marking the birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr. It is observed on the third Monday of January each year, which is around the time of King\'s birthday, January 15.

150126~Australia~Australia Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_Day~The official national day of Australia, celebrated annually on 26 January, which marks the anniversary of the 1788 arrival of the First Fleet of British Ships at Sydney Cove, New South Wales, and raising of the Flag of Great Britain at that site by Governor Arthur Phillip

150309~Australia~Canberra Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canberra_Day~A public holiday held annually on the second Monday in March in the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) to celebrate the official naming of Canberra. Observed in Australian Capital Territory.
150403~Australia~Good Friday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday~Commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary

150404~Australia~Easter Saturday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Saturday~Easter Saturday, or Bright Saturday, on the Christian calendar is the Saturday following the festival of Easter, the Saturday of Easter or Bright Week.

150406~Australia~Easter Monday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday~Easter Monday in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar is the second day of the octave of Easter Week and analogously in the Eastern Orthodox Church is the second day of Bright Week.

150425~Australia~ANZAC Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anzac_Day~a national day of remembrance in Australia and New Zealand that broadly commemorates all Australians and New Zealanders "who served and died in all wars, conflicts, and peacekeeping operations" and "the contribution and suffering of all those who have served."

150608~Australia~Queens Birthday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen\'s_Official_Birthday~The selected day on which the birthday of the monarch of the Commonwealth realms (currently Queen Elizabeth II) is officially celebrated

151005~Australia~Labour Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Day~Annual holiday to celebrate the achievements of workers. Observed in Australian Capital Territory, New South Wales and South Australia.
151225~Australia~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
151226~Australia~Boxing Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Day~The first or second weekday after Christmas Day

160101~Australia~New Year\’s Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar as well as the Julian calendar used in the Roman Empire since 45 BC.
150403~UK~Good Friday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday~Commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary

150406~UK~Easter Monday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday~Easter Monday in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar is the second day of the octave of Easter Week and analogously in the Eastern Orthodox Church is the second day of Bright Week.Observed in England, Northern Ireland and Wales.
150504~UK~May Day Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/May_Day~A traditional spring holiday and coincides with International Workers\' Day
150525~UK~Spring Bank Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_holiday~Last Monday in May
150803~UK~Summer Bank Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_holiday~First Monday in August. Observed in Scotland.
150831~UK~Summer Bank Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_holiday~Last Monday in August. Observed in England, Northern Ireland and Wales.
151031~UK~Halloween~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halloween~A yearly celebration on 31 October, the eve of the Western Christian feast of All Hallows\' Day

151105~UK~Guy Fawkes Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Fawkes_Night~Guy Fawkes Day, also known as Guy Fawkes Night, Bonfire Night and Firework Night, is an annual commemoration observed on 5 November
151225~UK~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
151226~UK~Boxing Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Day~The first or second weekday after Christmas Day
160101~UK~New Year\’s Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar as well as the Julian calendar used in the Roman Empire since 45 BC.
